Questions.Question: How many moons does Mars have?
Questions.details: Mars has 2 moons. They are named Phobos, meaning fear and Deimos, which is greek for panik.

Questions.Question: What is Marsâ€™s nickname?
Questions.details: Rusted iron particles in rocks give mars it's distinct red hue

Questions.Question: About how long would it take to travel to Mars?
Questions.details: Earth and Mars follow different orbits around the Sun, so space explorers must wait until the two planets are close together to blast off.Even then, the trip would take a minimum of about eight months.

Questions.Question: True or false? Scientists have found evidence of liquid water on Mars.
Questions.details: Scientist think Mars once had rivers, lakes and maybe even oceans. Today small amounts of water trickle down crater walls

Questions.Question: This planet is named after the Roman god Mars. What is he the god of?
Questions.details: Ancient people (greeks? romans? inkas?... who ?) thought the planet looked as red as blood and named it after the roman god of war
